qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's main goal?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India aims to provide all children in India with an excellent education. They focus on addressing the education crisis and creating lasting change. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by applying for the Fellowship program, volunteering your time, donating, or joining the Teach For India team. Each option helps build a better India. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a teaching program that connects social change with personal development. It involves teaching in under-resourced schools and becoming part of a network of leaders. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find answers to frequently asked questions?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find answers to FAQs on the Teach For India website. Look for the 'FAQ' link in the navigation menu. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility requirements to apply for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: To be eligible, you must have completed graduation by June/July 2026, be applying for the first time for the 2026 cohort since July 2025, and be a citizen of India or an Overseas Citizen of India(OCI). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Will I receive training if I don't have prior teaching experience?
qa_pairs.answer: No prior teaching experience is required. Teach For India provides the essential training needed to prepare you for success in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What are the stages in the Teach For India Fellowship selection process?
qa_pairs.answer: The selection process has two stages: an application form and an assessment centre. The assessment centre includes sample teaching, critical thinking exercises, a group activity, and an interview. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: In which cities does Teach For India offer Fellowship placements?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers placements in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kolkata, and Mumbai. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What is 'The Conference of the Birds' about?
qa_pairs.answer: 'The Conference of the Birds' is a Sufi, Hamilton-inspired hip-hop musical by Teach For India students about a journey of Liberty, Equality, Fraternity, and Justice. It explores the question: What is India? Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: Where can I see 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: You can see 'The Conference of the Birds' in Mumbai (June 3 & 4), Bengaluru (July 29 & 30), and Delhi (August 12 & 13). You can book tickets on the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is India & I Studies?
qa_pairs.answer: India & I Studies is a set of free lesson plans developed by Teach For India to deepen students' awareness and practice of Constitutional Values. It is available to any student, educator, or parent. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to Teach For India for these shows?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find donation details on the website for organizations or individuals interested in supporting the shows. A 'Donate Now' link is provided on the page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is the education crisis Teach For India is addressing?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India addresses the crisis where children living in poverty are severely affected by unequal education opportunities, hindering their life choices. They aim to provide an excellent, equitable education to all of India's children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: How can I contribute to Teach For India's mission?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contribute to Teach For India's mission by donating, volunteering, or working with them. Check out the "Donate," "Volunteer," and "Work With Us" options on their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: What is the Fellowship program mentioned on the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship is a program at Teach For India. For more information about the specifics of the program and how to apply, visit the Fellowship section of their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: How can I stay updated with Teach For India's latest news and updates?
qa_pairs.answer: You can stay updated by signing up with your email on their website to receive the latest news. You can also follow them on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: Where is Teach For India's registered office located?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's registered office is located in Mumbai, specifically at Godrej One, 2nd Floor, Pirojshanagar, Eastern Express Highway, Vikhroli (East), Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400079. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: How can I find the contact information for Teach For India offices in other cities besides Mumbai?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find the addresses for Teach For India offices in Pune, Chennai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, and Kolkata on the Contact Us page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of quick links are available on the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The website offers quick links to information about The ED Crisis, Our Impact, The Fellowship, About Teach For India, InnovatED, Application information, FAQs, Donation information, Child Protection Policy, Alumni information, Volunteer opportunities, Contact information, Financials, information on How To Be A Fellow, and their Privacy and other policies. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: How can I stay updated on the latest news from Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can stay updated by signing up with your email on the website to receive the latest news. Also, you can follow them on their social media channels like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact does Teach For India have?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has a visible, measurable, and significant impact on students, Fellows, alumni, and the broader community. This includes academic and socio-emotional progress for students, and leadership development for Fellows and alumni. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What do Teach For India Fellows do?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India Fellows teach in classrooms and create reimagined education spaces where students are safe, loved, and challenged. They also set up 'Be The Change Projects' to address challenges in their school communities. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: Can you give me some examples of student success stories from Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes! Prachi Dalvi stood 2nd amongst all Grade 10 BMC Schools in Mumbai. Suraj Gupta studies at IIT Kharagpur today and Rutuja Bhoite now studies at the Lake Forest College in Chicago. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: How do school principals view Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Principals generally have a positive view. 96% believe that Teach For India Fellows will have a lifetime impact on students, and 92% believe that Teach For India classrooms in their school are high-performing. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What are the terms of use for the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The Terms of Use govern your access and use of the Teach For India website (www.teachforindia.org). By using the website, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: Who operates the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India website is operated by Teach To Lead, an entity registered as "Teach to Lead". Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: What should I do if I disagree with the terms of service?
qa_pairs.answer: If you disagree with the Terms of Service, you should not use the website. However, you can email info@teachforindia.org to discuss your concerns. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's privacy policy?
qa_pairs.answer: The Privacy Policy is posted on the Teach For India website and is incorporated by reference into the Terms of Use. By using the website, you agree to abide by the Privacy Policy. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: What kind of benefits does Teach For India offer its staff?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India provides its staff with benefits such as flexibility, healthcare coverage, comprehensive leave policies, continuous learning opportunities, global support through the Teach For All network, and well-being initiatives. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: How can I apply to work at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can view the current staff openings and apply through the "View Staff Openings" link on the Teach For India careers page. You can also apply for the Campus Ambassador position by clicking the link provided. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What makes working at Teach For India unique?
qa_pairs.answer: Working at Teach For India allows you to address India's pressing challenges, collaborate with passionate individuals, and work in a culture of trust and compassion. You also have the autonomy to shape your role and drive your learning and growth. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's mission?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India strives to build a nation free of poverty and filled with love by keeping children and people at the center of all they do. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What does Teach For India do?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India works towards an excellent and equitable education for all children in India by placing Fellows in classrooms and developing Alumni who work to improve the education system. Your donations directly support these efforts. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: Is my donation to Teach For India tax deductible?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, donations to Teach For India are eligible for a 50% tax exemption under Section 80G of the Income Tax Act, 1961, but this is valid only for Indian citizens. You will receive a tax exemption receipt within 30 days of your donation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: I'm not an Indian citizen. Can I still donate to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can still donate to Teach For India even if you're not an Indian citizen. You can donate through Teach For India's U.S. partner website or through their campaigns on Global Giving. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: I donated to the Conference of the Birds musical. How do I get my guest passes?
qa_pairs.answer: After donating ₹1,00,000, ₹50,000 or ₹25,000, you need to fill out the form provided to indicate how many guest passes you require for the upcoming shows. The form link should be found on the donation page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's refund policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers a refund policy for Indian donors only in cases of error or technical reasons that led to duplicate or incorrect donations. For foreign donors, refunds are not possible once the funds are transferred due to FCRA regulations. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: How can I request a refund for a donation I made to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: To request a refund, send valid proof of deduction to donationreceipt@teachforindia.org within 30 days of the donation date. Note that refunds are generally only considered for Indian donors due to errors or technical issues. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: When will I receive a receipt for my donation?
qa_pairs.answer: You will receive a donation receipt via email within 15 working days of Teach For India receiving your donation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about my donation?
qa_pairs.answer: For any questions regarding your donation, please email donate@teachforindia.org. You can expect a response during their working hours (9 AM – 6 PM IST, Monday to Friday). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering with Teach For India allows you to work directly with students, collaborate with Fellows, and gain experience in the Indian education system, all while contributing to educational equity. You'll be expected to dedicate a minimum of 50 hours to supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: What is the minimum time commitment required for volunteering?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to make a minimum commitment of 50 hours supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact can I have as a volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: As a volunteer, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to the holistic learning and development of students from low-income communities. You can also help to reimagine and transform education in India. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: Where can I sign up to volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer by clicking on the 'Register Now' button on the Teach For India volunteer page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by donating, volunteering, or working with Teach For India. Visit https://www.teachforindia.org/search to find links to each of these opportunities.

qa_pairs.question: How can I stay updated on Teach For India's work?
qa_pairs.answer: You can stay connected by signing up with your email to receive the latest updates or by following Teach For India on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find answers to frequently asked questions?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find answers to frequently asked questions in the FAQ section of the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: What kind of policies does Teach For India have regarding user information?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has a Privacy Policy, Terms of Use, and Refund Policy that you can review. You can also find a Child Protection Policy on their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: What kind of information does Teach For India track about visitors to its website?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India tracks location, device type, and browser type to understand website visitor needs. This data is aggregated and anonymized to remove personally identifiable information. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: Will Teach For India share my personal information with other organizations?
qa_pairs.answer: No, Teach For India states that they will never share, sell, or rent your individual personal information with or to any individual or organization without your advance permission or unless ordered by a court of law. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India use cookies on its website?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India uses client-side cookies to verify the login status of visitors and registered users. Rejecting cookies may prevent logging in or accessing all areas of the site. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: How will I be notified if Teach For India changes its privacy policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India will post changes to its privacy policy on its website. They will also notify users via email at the last provided address and/or by prominently posting a notice on the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's vision?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's vision is that one day all children will attain an excellent education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by joining their team, volunteering your time, or donating to support a child's education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a teaching programme that connects social change with personal development. It's a teaching program that aims to develop fellows into leaders.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find answers to frequently asked questions?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find answers to FAQs on the Teach For India website. Look for the 'FAQs' link in the navigation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering with Teach For India involves working directly with students, collaborating with Fellows in the classroom, and gaining exposure to the state of education in India. You'll contribute to the impact of education while learning about inequities and growing your leadership skills. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: How many hours am I expected to commit as a volunteer?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to make a minimum commitment of 50 hours supporting a Fellow in the classroom. You will also receive a certificate after completing your commitment. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact does Teach For India have on students?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India aims to ensure all children attain an excellent education. Students have gone on to achieve impressive feats, from excelling in academics to pursuing higher education at prestigious institutions and becoming leaders in their communities. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: Where can I sign up to volunteer?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer through the "Register Now" button on the Teach For India volunteer page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria to apply for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: To be eligible, you must have completed graduation by June/July 2026, be applying for the first time for the 2026 Fellowship cohort since July 2025, and be a citizen of India or an Overseas Citizen of India (OCI). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India require prior teaching experience for the Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: No, prior teaching experience is not required. Teach For India provides the necessary training to prepare you for success in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Can you describe the Teach For India Fellowship selection process?
qa_pairs.answer: The selection process has two stages: Application Form and Assessment Centre. The stages are designed to assess your strengths and motivations for the role. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Which cities offer Teach For India Fellowship placements?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers placements in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, and Kolkata. While the content doesn't fully list all 8, it names these specific cities as placement locations. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's financial reports?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's financial reports, including FCRA donations, and annual reports on their Financials page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: Is Teach For India a transparent organization?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India has received accreditation from Credibility Alliance, which indicates a commitment to accountability and transparency. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What kind of organizational documents does Teach For India have available?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India provides access to documents such as their Registration Certificate, Income Tax Certificate, 80G Certificate, and PAN Card on their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's annual reports?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's annual reports, spanning various years, on their Financials page under the 'Annual Reports' section. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What is 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: 'The Conference of the Birds' is a Sufi, Hamilton-inspired hip-hop musical by Teach For India featuring students. It's about a group of students on a journey of Liberty, Equality, Fraternity, and Justice, exploring the question: What is India? Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: Where and when can I see 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: The musical will be performed in Mumbai on June 3 & 4, Bengaluru on July 29 & 30, and Delhi on August 12 & 13. You can book your tickets through the provided link on the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is India & I Studies?
qa_pairs.answer: India & I Studies is a set of free lesson plans developed by Teach For India for students of all ages. It aims to deepen their awareness and practice of constitutional values and can be used by any student, educator, or parent. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to support 'The Conference of the Birds' shows?
qa_pairs.answer: Details for donating to support 'The Conference of the Birds' can be found through the 'Donate Now' link. This will take you to information for organizations or individuals interested in donating towards one of the shows. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's vision?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's vision is that one day all children will attain an excellent education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by joining their team, volunteering your time, or donating to support a child's education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a teaching program that connects social change with personal development. Fellows teach in under-resourced schools and become part of a network of leaders working to shape India's future. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find answers to frequently asked questions?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find answers to FAQs on the Teach For India website. Look for the 'FAQs' link in the header or footer navigation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility requirements to apply for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: To be eligible for the 2026 Fellowship cohort, you must have completed graduation by June/July 2026, be applying for the first time since July 2025, and be a citizen of India or an Overseas Citizen of India (OCI). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India require prior teaching experience for the Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: No, prior teaching experience is not required. Teach For India provides the necessary training to prepare you for success in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What does the Teach For India Fellowship selection process involve?
qa_pairs.answer: The selection process has two stages: an application form and an assessment center. The assessment center includes activities like sample teaching, critical thinking exercises, a group activity, and an interview. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: In which cities does Teach For India place Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has placement cities in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, and Kolkata. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a teaching program where individuals teach in under-resourced schools, driving social change and gaining personal development. Fellows become part of a network of leaders and edupreneurs. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: How can I help Teach For India's mission?
qa_pairs.answer: You can support Teach For India by donating, volunteering your time, or joining their team. These actions help build a better India for all children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's vision?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's vision is that one day all children in India will attain an excellent education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact is Teach For India having?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India reports that 89% of their Grade 10 students graduated successfully from school in 2023. They're making a positive impact on education in India. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria to apply for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: To be eligible, you must have completed graduation by June/July 2026, be applying for the first time for the 2026 Fellowship cohort since July 2025, and be a citizen of India or an Overseas Citizen of India (OCI). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India require prior teaching experience to become a Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: No, prior teaching experience is not required. Teach For India provides the necessary training to prepare you for success in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What does the selection process for the Teach For India Fellowship involve?
qa_pairs.answer: The selection process has two stages: an application form where you share your academic and professional history, and an assessment center that includes sample teaching, critical thinking exercises, a group activity, and an interview. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Which cities does Teach For India place Fellows in?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has placement cities in Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad and Kolkata. While you can indicate a placement preference, it is not guaranteed. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What is 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: It is a Sufi, Hamilton-inspired hip-hop musical presented by Teach For India, co-written and directed by former 'Maya' students. It's a tale of students on a journey of Liberty, Equality, Fraternity, and Justice, exploring the question 'What is India?'. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: Where and when can I see 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: The musical is showing in Mumbai on June 3rd and 4th, in Bengaluru on July 29th & 30th, and in Delhi on August 12th & 13th. You can book tickets on the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is India & I Studies?
qa_pairs.answer: India & I Studies is a set of lesson plans developed by Teach For India for students of all ages to deepen their awareness and practice of Constitutional Values. It is free for any student, educator or parent. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to Teach For India for 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find donation details on the website for organizations or individuals interested in supporting the shows. There is a 'Donate Now' button that can be used to make a contribution. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is the education crisis Teach For India is addressing?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is working to address the fact that many children in India, especially those living in poverty, do not have access to excellent and equitable education. This limits their life choices and perpetuates inequality. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India committed to?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is committed to fueling India with leaders at all levels of the system who will work together to provide an excellent, equitable education to all children, guaranteeing them Liberty, Equality, Fraternity and Justice. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved with Teach For India by donating, volunteering, or working with them. You can find links to these options on their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: What kind of updates does Teach For India send via email?
qa_pairs.answer: By signing up with your email, you can receive the latest updates on Teach For India's activities and initiatives. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: How can I contact Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's contact information, including addresses for their Mumbai, Pune, Chennai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, and Kolkata offices, on their Contact Us page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: Where is Teach For India's registered office located?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's registered office is in Mumbai, at Godrej One, 2nd Floor, Pirojshanagar, Eastern Express Highway, Vikhroli (East), Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400079. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of updates can I receive if I sign up with my email?
qa_pairs.answer: By signing up with your email on the Teach For India website, you can receive the latest updates about the organization. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: Besides contacting them, what else can I do to support Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can support Teach For India by donating, volunteering, or working with them. They also have programs for alumni. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact does Teach For India have?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India focuses on student impact, and fellow & alumni impact. They aim to create safe, loving, and challenging learning spaces for students, while also fostering leadership among Fellows and Alumni. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: How long do students typically spend in a Teach For India classroom?
qa_pairs.answer: Students spend up to 8 years in a Teach For India classroom where they explore, dream and take steps to realise their dreams. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What kind of projects do Teach For India fellows initiate?
qa_pairs.answer: Fellows have set up 'Be The Change Projects' to address challenges in their school communities. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: How do principals view Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: 96% of principals believe that Teach For India Fellows will have a lifetime impact on students, and 92% believe Teach For India classrooms are high-performing, demonstrating impact in academic and holistic outcomes. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What are the terms of use for the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The terms of use outline the agreement between you and Teach For India (Teach to Lead) when accessing their website. By using the website, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's privacy policy?
qa_pairs.answer: The privacy policy is posted on the Teach For India website and is incorporated into the terms of use by reference. It explains how Teach For India collects, safeguards, and discloses information resulting from your use of their website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: What should I do if I disagree with the terms of use?
qa_pairs.answer: If you disagree with the terms of use, you should not use the Teach For India website. You can also email info@teachforindia.org to discuss your concerns and potentially find a solution. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: Can Teach For India guarantee uninterrupted website access?
qa_pairs.answer: No, Teach For India does not guarantee that the website will be secure, continuously accessible, or completely error-free 100% of the time. They are not liable for breaches of security, interruptions, delays, or errors beyond what's outlined in the terms. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: What kind of benefits do you offer staff at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers benefits including flexibility, healthcare coverage, comprehensive leave policies, continuous learning opportunities, global support through the Teach For All network, and well-being initiatives. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: How can I apply for a job at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can view and apply for staff openings through the "View Staff Openings" link on the careers page. There's also a link to apply for the Campus Ambassador position. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What's unique about working at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Working at Teach For India allows you to address India's education crisis, collaborate with passionate individuals, and work in a culture of trust and autonomy, enabling significant impact and personal growth. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What are the core values that drive Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is driven by a mission to build a nation free of poverty and filled with love, keeping children and people at the center of their work. They strive for excellence and impact through an ecosystem of care and support. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can donate through the Teach For India website. If you're donating from outside India, email donate@teachforindia.org. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: Are donations to Teach For India tax-deductible?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, donations are eligible for tax exemption under section 80G of the Income Tax Act, 1961, resulting in a 50% tax exemption. This is valid only for Indian Citizens. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: I'm not an Indian citizen. Can I still donate?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can still donate. You can donate through Teach For India's U.S. partner website or through their campaigns on Global Giving. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: What impact does my donation have?
qa_pairs.answer: Your donation will have an immediate impact in a classroom and create a sustained long-term impact on the education system by supporting students, fellows and alumni. Contributions might equip students with classroom supplies or support training events for fellows. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's refund policy for donations?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has a refund policy for donation errors (duplicate payments or incorrect amounts) made by Indian donors. No refunds are issued for donations made through the online payment gateway once accepted, except in cases of fraud. Foreign donations are generally not refundable due to FCRA regulations. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: How do I request a refund for a donation to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: To request a refund, email donationreceipt@teachforindia.org with valid proof of deduction within 30 days of making the donation. Note that refunds for foreign donations are typically not possible. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: When will I receive a receipt for my donation?
qa_pairs.answer: You should receive a receipt for your donation via email within 15 working days of Teach For India receiving the donation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about my donation to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: For questions about donations, you can email donate@teachforindia.org. They respond to queries during working hours (9 AM – 6 PM IST, Monday to Friday). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering involves working directly with students, collaborating with Teach For India Fellows in the classroom, and gaining exposure to the state of education in India. Volunteers are expected to commit a minimum of 50 hours. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of volunteering with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering allows you to work with students, collaborate with Fellows, gain insight into educational equity, engage in reflective dialogues, and grow your learning and leadership skills. It's a chance to contribute to educational transformation in India. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How much time commitment is expected for volunteers?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to make a minimum commitment of 50 hours supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How do I register to volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer with Teach For India by clicking the 'Register Now' button available on the volunteer page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by donating, volunteering, or working with Teach For India. Visit https://www.teachforindia.org/search to find relevant opportunities.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find the FAQ section on the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find the FAQ section through the main navigation or footer on the Teach For India website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: How can I stay updated on the latest news from Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can stay connected by signing up with your email on the Teach For India website to receive updates. You can also follow them on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India have a policy regarding child protection?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India has a Child Protection Policy. You can find the policy linked in the footer of the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/search

qa_pairs.question: What information does Teach For India track on its website?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India tracks location, device type, and browser type to understand visitor needs and improve website design. This data is aggregated and anonymized to remove personally identifiable characteristics. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: Will Teach For India share my personal information with other organizations?
qa_pairs.answer: No, Teach For India will never share, sell, or rent your individual personal information to any individual or organization without your advance permission, unless required by a court of law. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: What are cookies used for on the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: Cookies are used to verify the login status of visitors and registered users. Rejecting cookies may prevent you from logging in or accessing all areas of the site. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: How will I be notified if Teach For India changes its privacy policy?
qa_pairs.answer: If Teach For India changes its privacy policy, they will post the changes on their website and/or notify users via email at the last provided address. You will have a choice as to whether or not they use your information in the new manner. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering involves working directly with students, collaborating with Teach For India Fellows in the classroom, and gaining exposure to the educational landscape in India. Volunteers will also have opportunities to reflect on education and contribute to students' holistic learning. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: How long is the minimum commitment for volunteering?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to commit a minimum of 50 hours to supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of volunteering with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering provides opportunities to work with students, collaborate with Fellows, gain grassroots experience in education, engage in reflection on transforming education, and grow your learning and leadership. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: How do I register to become a volunteer?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer through the "Register Now" button found on the Teach For India volunteering page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's financial reports?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's financial reports, including FCRA Donations and Annual Reports, on their Financials page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: Is Teach For India a transparent organization?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India has received accreditation from Credibility Alliance, which promotes accountability and transparency in the voluntary sector. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What kind of documents are included in the Organisational Documents section?
qa_pairs.answer: The Organisational Documents section includes the Registration Certificate, Income Tax Certificate, 80 G Certificate, and PAN Card. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What information is provided in Teach For India's annual reports?
qa_pairs.answer: The annual reports provide an overview of activities across departments, progress and results achieved, information on board members, remuneration, reimbursements, and brief financial details. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What is InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED is Teach For India's national platform for incubating entrepreneurs who are building impactful organizations in education. It supports alumni in their early stages as education entrepreneurs, helping them take their innovations from prototype to sustainable organization. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: How does InnovatED support education entrepreneurs?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED provides a nine-month incubation platform with physical bootcamps, virtual cohort calls and webinars, and digital learning resources. It also includes a stipend and coaching support to help education entrepreneurs succeed. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: What is the ultimate goal of InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: The vision of InnovatED is to create a connected community of education entrepreneurs across India. This community will learn from and support each other to create a new narrative for education in the country. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: Who is InnovatED for?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED is specifically for Teach For India alumni who are in the early stages of building an organization focused on education. It is designed to help them transition from working at the grassroots to leading their own sustainable organizations. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's Child Protection Policy about?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's Child Protection Policy (CPP) demonstrates their commitment to protecting the safety and well-being of children involved in their programs. The policy defines child abuse, outlines expected conduct for representatives, and provides guidelines for reporting any concerns. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: Who does the Child Protection Policy apply to?
qa_pairs.answer: The CPP applies to all part-time and full-time employees of Teach To Lead, including staff, fellows, and interns, as well as anyone contractually bound to the policy. It also extends to school HMs/Lead teachers, and Teach For India encourages low-income private schools to adopt similar policies. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: What are some examples of prohibited behaviors under the Child Protection Policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Prohibited behaviors include using inappropriate language, any form of corporal punishment, placing a child in a risky environment, and sharing inappropriate content. It's crucial to avoid any action that could cause physical, emotional, or sexual harm to a child. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: What constitutes child abuse according to Teach For India's policy?
qa_pairs.answer: According to the policy, child abuse includes all forms of physical or emotional ill-treatment, sexual abuse, neglect, or exploitation that could harm a child's health, survival, development, or dignity. It encompasses actions within a relationship of responsibility, trust, or power. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: Why should I consider joining the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship offers a chance to address educational inequity, impact children's lives, and develop leadership skills. You'll find purpose, become a leader, join a movement, and drive change at the grassroots level. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What is the time commitment for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a 2-year, full-time, paid commitment. Fellows are placed in under-resourced English-medium classrooms in government or low-income private schools. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What qualities does Teach For India look for in its Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India seeks individuals with a belief in equitable education, leadership potential, courage, problem-solving abilities, and collaborative skills. These qualities are essential for navigating the challenges of the Fellowship. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: How many Fellows are currently teaching with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Currently, Teach For India has approximately 490+ Year 1 Fellows and 430+ Year 2 Fellows teaching across eight cities in India. These numbers show the scale of the Teach For India fellowship program. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a two-year program where you teach full-time in an English medium government or affordable private school, while also gaining leadership experience. As a Fellow, you'll work to address educational inequity and develop skills to fuel your career. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What kind of skills will I develop as a Teach For India Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship helps you build concrete leadership skills such as stakeholder management, planning, envisioning, execution, and reflection. You'll also improve your communication, management, and teamwork abilities while connecting with students, teachers, and the community. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: Where are the Teach For India Fellows located?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India Fellows are placed in one of eight cities: Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Mumbai, or Pune. You will be teaching in a grade 1-10 classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What kind of people are Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India Fellows come from diverse backgrounds, including recent graduates, postgraduates, and professionals pivoting from corporate jobs. They are carefully chosen through a rigorous selection process that values leadership potential, problem-solving abilities, and a belief in equitable education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India and when was it founded?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is an organization founded in 2008 with the belief that all children must attain an excellent education. It was inspired by Teach For America. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: How many children are currently being taught by Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Currently, Teach For India has 900 Fellows teaching 33,000 children across India. Their Alumni are reaching 50 million children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: Can you tell me about Teach For India's History?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach for India has been around since 2008 and has grown considerably since then. They launched sites in Mumbai and Pune in 2009, Delhi in 2011 and more between 2012-2022. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: Who is the CEO of Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: The CEO of Teach For India is Shaheen Mistri. She is also the Founder and Board Member of The Akanksha Foundation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of organizations are eligible for InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: Social-impact organizations with a not-for-profit, for-profit, or hybrid model that have completed at least one pilot are eligible. The organization must fundamentally shift life outcomes for India's children from low-income families. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: If I've applied to InnovatED before, can I apply again?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, having applied earlier has no bearing on your application this year. Every application is considered a fresh one. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: Does InnovatED require me to work on a specific area of education?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is focusing on transformational schools and direct work with children, enablers of transformational outcomes, and policy and governance for educational equity. InnovatED projects should align with these areas. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: Is InnovatED a full-time commitment?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, to be incubated, you must be working full-time in your early-stage organization. If currently employed, you should be ready to leave your existing engagement. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is part of the Teach For All network, a group of independent organizations across 60 countries working to provide excellent education to all children. They offer a Fellowship program that connects social change with personal development. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by joining the Teach For India team, volunteering your time, or donating to support a child's education. You can also apply for the Fellowship program. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a teaching program that connects social change with personal development. It's a teaching program that connects far-reaching social change with invaluable personal development. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact does Teach For India have?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has a significant positive impact. For example, 89% of their Grade 10 Students graduated successfully from school in 2023. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: To be eligible for the 2026 Fellowship cohort, you must have completed graduation by June/July 2026, be applying for the first time for the 2026 cohort since July 2025, and be a citizen of India or an Overseas Citizen of India (OCI). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India require prior teaching experience to become a Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: No, prior teaching experience is not required. Teach For India provides the necessary training to prepare you for success in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What are the stages in the Teach For India Fellowship selection process?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship selection process consists of two stages: an Application Form and an Assessment Centre. The Assessment Centre includes activities like sample teaching, critical thinking exercises, a group activity, and an interview. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: In which cities can I be placed as a Teach For India Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has placement cities including Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, and Kolkata. You may indicate a placement preference during the selection process. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/become-a-fellow

qa_pairs.question: What is 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: It's a Sufi, Hamilton-inspired hip-hop musical about students on a journey of Liberty, Equality, Fraternity, and Justice, presented by Teach For India. It explores the question: What is India? Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: Where and when can I see 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: The musical will be performed in Mumbai on June 3rd and 4th, Bengaluru on July 29th and 30th, and Delhi on August 12th and 13th. You can book tickets through the link on the website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is 'India & I Studies'?
qa_pairs.answer: It's a set of lesson plans developed by Teach For India to deepen students' awareness and practice of Constitutional Values. It's free for any student, educator, or parent. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to support 'The Conference of the Birds'?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find details on donating towards the shows by clicking the 'Donate Now' link on the webpage. This will take you to the appropriate donation information. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/cotb-interim

qa_pairs.question: What is the education crisis Teach For India is addressing?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is addressing the lack of excellent and equitable education for children in India, particularly those living in poverty, which limits their life choices. They aim to create a movement of leaders working to guarantee Liberty, Equality, Fraternity and Justice for all children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: How can I help Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can help Teach For India by donating, volunteering, or working with them. The website also lists opportunities for alumni to get involved. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's commitment?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is committed to fueling India with leadership that will provide an excellent, equitable education to all of India's children, guaranteeing them Liberty, Equality, Fraternity and Justice. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about the Fellowship, as well as other programs, in the 'The Fellowship' section linked on the Teach For India website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/education-crisis

qa_pairs.question: Where is Teach For India's Mumbai office located?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Mumbai office is located at Godrej One, 2nd Floor, Pirojshanagar, Eastern Express Highway, Vikhroli (East), Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400079. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: How can I get the latest updates from Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can stay connected by signing up with your email address on the Teach For India website to receive the latest updates. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: Besides Mumbai, where else does Teach For India have offices?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has offices in Pune, Chennai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, and Kolkata, in addition to Mumbai. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: I'm interested in Teach For India's policies, where can I find them?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find information on Teach For India's Child Protection Policy, Privacy Policy, Terms of Use, and Refund Policy at the bottom of the contact page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/contact-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of impact does Teach For India have?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India focuses on student, fellow, and alumni impact, aiming to create visible, measurable, and significant positive change in education and society. They measure student academic and socio-emotional progress. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: How long do students typically spend in a Teach For India classroom?
qa_pairs.answer: Students spend up to 8 years in a Teach For India classroom where they explore, dream, and take steps to realise their dreams. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What is the CENTA Teacher Olympiad and how do Teach For India Fellows perform?
qa_pairs.answer: Many Teach For India Fellows have been selected in the top national or regional ranks at the CENTA Teacher Olympiad. The website does not explain specifically what CENTA is other than an Olympiad. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What do school principals think about Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: 96% of school principals believe that Teach For India Fellows will have a lifetime impact on students. 92% believe that Teach For India classrooms in their school are high-performing, demonstrating impact in academic and holistic outcomes. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/our-impact

qa_pairs.question: What are the terms of use for the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The terms of use govern your access and use of the Teach For India website (www.teachforindia.org). By using the website, you agree to be bound by these terms, including the Privacy Policy. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: If I don't agree with the terms of use, can I still use the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: If you do not agree with the Terms and Agreements, then you may not use the service. You can email info@teachforindia.org so that they can find a solution. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: When were the Teach For India terms and conditions last updated?
qa_pairs.answer: The Terms and Conditions for the Teach For India website were last updated on October 31, 2022. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: Who operates the Teach For India website?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India website is operated by Teach To Lead. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/terms-of-use

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of working for Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers benefits such as flexibility, healthcare, comprehensive leave, continuous learning opportunities, global support through the Teach For All network, and well-being initiatives. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: How can I find available staff positions at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can view current staff openings by clicking on the "View Staff Openings" link on the Teach For India careers page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: What kind of people work at Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India's staff comprises a diverse group of exceptional individuals who are passionate, talented, and committed to building a nation free of poverty and filled with love. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India offer opportunities to work remotely?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India operates with a culture of trust and outcomes, allowing staff to work from across the country and deliver excellent results remotely. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/careers

qa_pairs.question: How can I donate to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can donate directly through the Teach For India website. If you are donating from outside India, email donate@teachforindia.org for instructions. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: Are donations to Teach For India tax-deductible?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, donations made by Indian citizens to Teach For India are 50% exempt from tax under Section 80G of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: What impact does my donation have?
qa_pairs.answer: Your donation creates an immediate impact in classrooms and contributes to long-term improvements in the education system. Contributions support students, fellows, and alumni programs. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: I'm not an Indian citizen. Can I still donate?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can still donate! You can donate through Teach For India's U.S. partner website, Teach For India U.S., or through their campaigns on Global Giving. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/donate

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's refund policy for donations?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India offers refunds for Indian donors only in cases of errors like duplicate payments or donating a greater amount than intended. Foreign donations are generally non-refundable. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: How do I request a refund for a donation I made to Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: To request a refund, send an email with proof of deduction to donationreceipt@teachforindia.org within 30 days of making the donation.  No refund will be processed once a tax certificate has been issued in your name. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: When will I receive a receipt for my donation?
qa_pairs.answer: You will receive a receipt for your donation via email within 15 working days of Teach For India receiving the donation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: Who can I contact if I have questions about my donation?
qa_pairs.answer: For any information relating to a donation, please email donate@teachforindia.org. They respond to queries during working hours (9 AM – 6 PM IST, Monday to Friday). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/refund-policy

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering with Teach For India involves working directly with students, collaborating with Fellows, gaining exposure to the state of education in India, and contributing to the impact of education. You'll work in classrooms and engage with children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How many hours am I expected to commit if I volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to commit a minimum of 50 hours supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of volunteering with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering offers the chance to work with students, collaborate with Fellows, gain grassroots-level experience in education, engage in reflecting dialogues, and grow your learning, impact, and leadership. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How do I register to volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer by using the 'Register Now' button on the volunteer page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer

qa_pairs.question: How can I get involved with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get involved by donating, volunteering, or working with Teach For India. Visit https://www.teachforindia.org/search to find options and relevant links.

qa_pairs.question: I'm an alumnus of Teach For India. Where can I find information specifically for alumni?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India has a dedicated section for alumni. You can find it through the main navigation menu at https://www.teachforindia.org/search under "For Alumni."

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find the privacy policy for Teach For India's website?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's privacy policy at https://www.teachforindia.org/search. It's linked in the footer of the website.

qa_pairs.question: What resources does Teach For India offer?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India provides resources related to education, the Teach For India Fellowship, and information about their impact and mission. These resources are linked within their website: https://www.teachforindia.org/search.

qa_pairs.question: What kind of information does Teach For India track about website visitors?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India tracks location, device type, and browser type to understand visitors' needs related to website design. This is done in a way that aggregates data and removes identifiable characteristics, making your personal information non-personally identifiable. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: Will Teach For India share my personal information with other organizations?
qa_pairs.answer: No, Teach For India will never share, sell, or rent your individual personal information with any individual or organization without your advance permission or unless ordered by a court of law. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: Does Teach For India use cookies?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India uses client-side cookies to verify the login status of visitors and registered users. These cookies are not linked to any personally identifiable information while you are on the site. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: How can I opt-out of receiving emails from Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Each email Teach For India sends contains instructions on how to opt-out of receiving future emails of any sort. You can also opt-out of having your information used for purposes not directly related to the site at the point where you provide the information. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/privacy-policy

qa_pairs.question: What does volunteering with Teach For India involve?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering with Teach For India involves working directly with students in classrooms, collaborating with Fellows, and gaining insights into the state of education in India. You'll have the opportunity to learn about inequities and contribute to the impact of education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: How many hours are required to volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteers are expected to make a minimum commitment of 50 hours supporting a Fellow in the classroom. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of volunteering with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Volunteering provides opportunities to work with students, collaborate with Fellows, gain insights into educational equity, engage in reflective dialogues, and grow your learning, impact, and leadership. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: How do I register to volunteer with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register to volunteer through the "Register Now" link on the Teach For India website. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/volunteer-old

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find Teach For India's financial reports?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find Teach For India's financial reports, including FCRA Donations & Financial Reports and Annual Reports, on the Financials page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: Is Teach For India transparent with its finances?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Teach For India has received accreditation from Credibility Alliance, which is committed to enhancing accountability and transparency in the voluntary sector. This suggests they prioritize good governance and financial transparency. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What kind of organizational documents does Teach For India make available?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India provides access to organizational documents such as their Registration Certificate, Income Tax Certificate, 80 G Certificate, and PAN Card. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What years of Annual Reports are available to view?
qa_pairs.answer: Annual reports are available from 2014-15 through 2023-24 on the Financials page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/financials

qa_pairs.question: What is InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED is Teach For India's national platform for incubating entrepreneurs who are building impactful organizations in the education sector. It supports alumni in their early stages, helping them move from prototype to sustainable organization. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: How does InnovatED help education entrepreneurs?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED provides a nine-month incubation platform with physical bootcamps, virtual webinars, and digital learning resources. Additionally, it offers stipends and coaching support to help entrepreneurs build and scale their organizations. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: What's the main goal of InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: The long-term vision of InnovatED is to create an interconnected community of education entrepreneurs across India. This community will support each other during and beyond the incubation process, fostering a new narrative for education in the country. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: How do I register for InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: You can register for InnovatED 2025 via the "Register for InnovatED 2025" link on the Teach For India InnovatED page. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India's Child Protection Policy about?
qa_pairs.answer: The Child Protection Policy (CPP) outlines Teach For India's commitment to safeguarding children's safety and well-being. It defines child abuse, establishes expected behaviors for representatives, and sets guidelines for reporting and addressing concerns. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: Who does Teach For India's Child Protection Policy apply to?
qa_pairs.answer: The CPP applies to all Teach To Lead employees (both part-time and full-time), including staff, fellows, and interns. It also applies to anyone contractually bound by the policy with Teach To Lead. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: What are some examples of prohibited behaviors according to the Child Protection Policy?
qa_pairs.answer: The policy prohibits using inappropriate language, corporal punishment, or placing a child in a harmful environment. Sharing inappropriate content and harming a child physically, emotionally, or sexually are also strictly prohibited. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about Teach For India's work?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about Teach For India's work on their website, including details about their impact, fellowship program, and how to get involved as a fellow, volunteer, or employee. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/child-protection-policy

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship about?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a 2-year, full-time, paid program where you'll teach in under-resourced schools and develop leadership skills to address educational inequity in India. You'll have the opportunity to impact students, develop leadership skills and be a change agent. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What qualities does Teach For India look for in a Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India seeks individuals with a belief in equitable education, leadership potential, courage, problem-solving abilities, and collaborative skills. They value applicants who are passionate about making a difference in the lives of children and are open to learning. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What kind of commitment is required for the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship requires a 2-year, full-time, paid commitment. Fellows are placed in under-resourced schools, working as teachers for a set of 40-80 students. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: How many current Fellows are working with Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Currently, there are approximately 490+ Year 1 Fellows and 430+ Year 2 Fellows teaching across eight cities. Over 4,500+ individuals have completed the Fellowship over the years. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/faqs

qa_pairs.question: What is the Teach For India Fellowship?
qa_pairs.answer: The Teach For India Fellowship is a two-year program where individuals have the opportunity to teach in under-resourced schools, impacting children's futures while developing leadership skills. It aims to address educational inequity in India. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What cities can I be placed in as a Teach For India Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: Fellows are located in one of these 8 cities: Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Mumbai or Pune. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What are some of the benefits of becoming a Teach For India Fellow?
qa_pairs.answer: The Fellowship helps you find your purpose, become a leader, join a large alumni network, and drive change by building an India free of poverty. You'll gain skills in stakeholder management, planning, and execution. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What are the qualities Teach For India looks for in Fellowship applicants?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India seeks applicants who believe in equitable education, demonstrate leadership potential, are open to learning, set ambitious goals, exhibit courage and problem-solving skills, and collaborate effectively. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/fellowship

qa_pairs.question: What is Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India is a non-profit organization founded in 2008 with the mission to provide excellent education to all children in India. They work through a fellowship program where individuals teach in under-resourced schools and contribute to systemic change in education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: When was Teach For India founded?
qa_pairs.answer: Teach For India was founded in 2008, inspired by Teach For America. They partnered with McKinsey & Company to develop a plan focused on ensuring every child receives a quality education. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: How many children are currently being taught by Teach For India Fellows?
qa_pairs.answer: Currently, Teach For India has a network of 900 Fellows who are teaching 33,000 children across India. Their 4,500+ alumni collectively reach 50 million children. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: Who is the CEO of Teach For India?
qa_pairs.answer: The CEO of Teach For India is Shaheen Mistri. She is also the Founder and Board Member of The Akanksha Foundation. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/about-us

qa_pairs.question: What kind of organizations can apply to InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: Social-impact organizations with a not-for-profit, a for-profit model, or a hybrid model that have completed at least one pilot can apply. The organization must also fundamentally shift life outcomes for India's children from low-income families. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: Does the entrepreneur applying to InnovatED need to be a Teach For India alumnus?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the incubated entrepreneur needs to be a Teach For India Alumnus or Alumna (Fellowship / Staff). Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: If I'm already part of another incubation program, can I still apply to InnovatED?
qa_pairs.answer: Potentially, but it depends. Teach For India will need to understand your availability before deciding on your candidature, but they encourage you to disclose the other program during the application process. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq

qa_pairs.question: Is InnovatED a part-time or full-time commitment?
qa_pairs.answer: InnovatED is a full-time commitment lasting 9 months. If selected, you must commit to being present for the duration of the program. Source: https://www.teachforindia.org/innovated-faq
